    Resources

    Looking for more resources on who to contact, what has been published about LGBTQ+ people in STEM, or what’s going on in our community? Look no further!

    LGBTQ+ Advocacy Groups:

    • Atlantic Canada
      • Nova Scotia:
        • The Youth Project
        • South House
        • DalOUT
      • New Brunswick
        • University of New Brunswick Spectrum
      • Newfoundland
        • MUN SAGA
      • PEI
        • PEERS Alliance
    • Beyond:
      • pflag Canada
      • LGBTSTEM
      • 500 Queer Scientists
      • Pride in STEM
      • QSTEM
      • Out in STEM

    Studies on LGBTQ+ people’s experiences in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics:

    • Allison Mattheis, Daniel Cruz-Ramírez De Arellano, Jeremy B. Yoder. 2019. A Model of Queer STEM Identity in the Workplace.
    • Bryce E. Hughes. 2018. Coming out in STEM: Factors affecting retention of sexual minority STEM students.
    • Jeremy B. Yoder and Allison Mattheis. 2015. Queer in STEM: Workplace Experiences Reported in a National Survey of LGBTQA Individuals in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics Careers
    • Association of American Universities. 2015. Climate Survey on Sexual Assault and Sexual Misconduct
    • Eric V. Patridge, Ramon S. Barthelemy, Susan R. Rankin. 2014. Factors Impacting the Academic Climate for LGBQ STEM Faculty. Journal of Women and Minorities in Science and Engineering
